meanings.definition: To meet or assemble again after a break or interruption.
meanings.sent1: After lunch, the students will reconvene in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The team will reconvene tomorrow to continue working on the project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels reconvened in the park after the rain stopped.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the birds reconvened in the trees for the night.
meanings.sent5: The family will reconvene at the dinner table for a delicious meal.

meanings.definition: To resume a meeting or session that was previously adjourned.
meanings.sent1: Let's reconvene the discussion on Monday morning.
meanings.sent2: The council will reconvene next week to finalize the budget.
meanings.sent3: The toys reconvened for a secret meeting in the toy chest.
meanings.sent4: The stars reconvened in the night sky, shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The class will reconvene after the bell rings for the next lesson.
